item.content:encoded:
I think you’re absolutely wrong about this. Anyone should be able to write about anything. Real diversity is diversity of thought. It’s fiction. Sometimes writing other skins colors or other sexualities helps a writer deal with trauma. No one will ever know what another person goes through, ever. Period. A mother will never know everything their child experiences. A spouse or a partner won’t either. Writing outside of one’s one personal situations can be cathartic and we support THAT kind of writing.
Like you mentioned, you were combing through a writer’s private to prove he was writing about ‘the right things’. Writing doesn’t have right or wrong. If you censor a writer based on their physical attributes that would be facism. Write anything and everything, even if it’s out of your wheelhouse. Those are the stories that will help bridge the gaps and bring people together.
